title: Karin Peretz
text:
Karin Peretz (born 7 October 1990) is an Israeli <a href="women%27s%20soccer">football</a> <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">Forward</a>, currently playing in the <a href="Ligat%20Nashim%20Rishona">Israeli First League</a> for <a href="Maccabi%20Be%27er%20Sheva%20F.C.%20%28women%29">Maccabi Be'er Sheva</a>.
Club career.
Born in <a href="Be%27er%20Sheva">Be'er Sheva</a>, Peretz played during her entire career with <a href="Maccabi%20Be%27er%20Sheva%20F.C.%20%28women%29">Maccabi Be'er Sheva</a>, reaching the <a href="Israeli%20Women%27s%20Cup">Israeli Women's Cup</a> final in <a href="2009%E2%80%9310%20Israeli%20Women%27s%20Cup">2010</a> and winning the League's second division with the club in <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20Ligat%20Nashim%23Ligat%20Nashim%20Shniya">2014–15</a>, as well as finishing as top scorer in the second division at the same season. During summer 2015, Peretz had to have surgery in her knee, missing the beginning of the <a href="2015%E2%80%9316%20Ligat%20Nashim">2015–16 season</a>.
International career.
Peretz played for the <a href="Israel%20women%27s%20national%20under-19%20football%20team">U-19 national team</a> in 2007 and 2008, appearing in 5 matches.
